Description.div: The root xml element of the header.
The country identifier for the models. The default country code is the users default country code.
Configurator item id of the node. For any given model the item ids are unique within that model. The id of the root node of a model is always 0.
The language identifier for the models to search for. The default language is the users default language.
The name of the model.
The path to the model.
A pick node contains the internal information about a pick.
The configurator item name for a pick.

The Id of the configurator item. This is applicable only for option items created dynamically through instantiateSubModel API. This value is initially captured while creating child model instances using instantiateSubModel API.
The quantity of the pick.

The type of action performed on the pick. For option items created dynamically through instantiateSubModel API, the type will be create. This value is initially captured while creating child model instances using instantiateSubModel API.
The user entered value associated with the item.

The configuration of the entire sub-model tree associated with the option item. The nested configuration includes all the configuration information from the descendants. This information is initially captured while returning from the sub-model.
This element has the header information of configurator BOM.

The full configurator name for the model.
ModelName is not passed.
The current BOM version.

This attribute is true if the model root has the container only flag set otherwise false.
Valid Values: true or false

This attribute is true if there are errors in the BOM, otherwise false.
Valid Values: true or false
BOMs can contain messages about the status of the configuration and are produced by rules or constraint tables.
Name of the message.

The type of the message in the configurator BOM.
Valid Values: error or warning or suggest
The displayable value for the message.
LineItems form a tree structure in that they can contain other line items. The top most LineItem is the root of the model.
An optional key for the item from an order. These keys are preserved if it is passed in the input. It will be returned in the output.
The description of the LineItem.
The item configurator ID for the item.
The visual modeler key for the item. This attribute is not considered in the input.
The unique name for the LineItem in a particular depth of the hierarchy.
The price of the LineItem.
The quantity of the item ordered for the LineItem.

This attribute is true if the item was picked by a rule otherwise false.
Valid Values: true or false
The sku associated to the LineItem.
The UOM associated to the LineItem.

This attribute is true if the item should be visible to the user in the order, otherwise false. Very often models contain information needed for reconfiguration that should not be visible in the order.
Valid Values: true or false

This attribute is true if the price in the BOM should used in the order, otherwise false.
Valid Values: true or false
The user entered value associated to the LineItem.

The holder of properties associated with the LineItem. It contains:
The Configurator Properties that are attached to the items in the model and flagged as "output" properties.
The external input properties injected into the model to influence its runtime behavior.
The flag to differentiate externally injected input properties from output properties. The attribute value is Y , if the property is an externally injected input property. Default value is N .
Name of the property.

The type of the property in the configurator BOM.
Valid Values: bigdecimal or int or List or long or double or String or date or unknown
The value of the property in string form.
LineItems form a tree structure in that they can contain other line items. The top most LineItem is the root of the model.
An optional key for the item from an order. These keys are preserved if it is passed in the input. It will be returned in the output.
The description of the LineItem.
The item configurator ID for the item.
The visual modeler key for the item. This attribute is not considered in the input.
The unique name for the LineItem in a particular depth of the hierarchy.
The price of the LineItem.
The quantity of the item ordered for the LineItem.

This attribute is true if the item was picked by a rule otherwise false.
Valid Values: true or false
The sku associated to the LineItem.
The UOM associated to the LineItem.

This attribute is true if the item should be visible to the user in the order, otherwise false. Very often models contain information needed for reconfiguration that should not be visible in the order.
Valid Values: true or false

This attribute is true if the price in the BOM should used in the order, otherwise false.
Valid Values: true or false
The user entered value associated to the LineItem.
The holder of additional line prices associated with the LineItem. It contains one or more AdditionalLinePrice elements.
Contains the details of an additional line price type that is associated to the LineItem.

This attribute is true if the price type value in the BOM should used in the order, otherwise false.
Valid Values: true or false
The price value of the price type.
The name of the price type
The output properties from the sub-model and its descendants associated with the option item. This information is initially captured while returning from the sub-model.
The holder of output properties.
This element holds information about properties associated to item.
The name of the property.
The path to the item that contains the property.

The datatype of the property.
Valid Values: bigdecimal or int or List or long or double or String or date or unknown
The value in string form for the property. List values are returned with each value separated by a carriage return.

div.p: The configuration of parent model(s) in the configuration path. The parent configuration at each level is captured separately under <parentConfiguration> element. This information is initially captured while punching into the sub-model from the parent model. This configuration is applicable only for sub-models.
The parentConfigurations element should be resent by the caller as-is without modification.

Description.div: The node contains the configuration details of a parent model. It also captures input properties for the model in this configuration.
The depth of the model with respect to the root model.
The path of the option item on which the punch was invoked. On return from sub model, the child configuration will be attached to this item.
The SubModelReturn flag indicates whether end-users return from sub model to the model in this configuration.
The SubModelValidate flag indicating whether the child configuration is validated on return from sub model.

div.p: A holder of input properties applicable for this particular parent configuration. It contains the properties derived from its parent state in the preceding <ParentConfiguration>, based on the input property list defined in the model in this configuration and/or external properties to this configuration when it was configured.

Description.div: This element holds information about input properties for the model in this configuration.
The flag to indicate whether the property is an external input property or not. Default value is N .
The name of the property in the property pool.
The path to a property from the property pool.
The datatype of the property.
The value of the property.
This element has the header information of configurator BOM.

The full configurator name for the model.
ModelName is not passed.
The current BOM version.

This attribute is true if the model root has the container only flag set otherwise false.
Valid Values: true or false

This attribute is true if there are errors in the BOM, otherwise false.
Valid Values: true or false
BOMs can contain messages about the status of the configuration and are produced by rules or constraint tables.
Name of the message.

The type of the message in the configurator BOM.
Valid Values: error or warning or suggest
The displayable value for the message.

The sku associated to the LineItem.

Valid Values: true or false

The Configurator Properties that are attached to the items in the model and flagged as "output" properties.
The external input properties injected into the model to influence its runtime behavior.
The flag to differentiate externally injected input properties from output properties. The attribute value is Y , if the property is an externally injected input property. Default value is N .
Name of the property.

The type of the property in the configurator BOM.
Valid Values: bigdecimal or int or List or long or double or String or date or unknown
The value of the property in string form.
LineItems form a tree structure in that they can contain other line items. The top most LineItem is the root of the model.
An optional key for the item from an order. These keys are preserved if it is passed in the input. It will be returned in the output.
The description of the LineItem.
The item configurator ID for the item.
The visual modeler key for the item. This attribute is not considered in the input.

Valid Values: true or false
The sku associated to the LineItem.
The UOM associated to the LineItem.

This attribute is true if the item should be visible to the user in the order, otherwise false. Very often models contain information needed for reconfiguration that should not be visible in the order.
Valid Values: true or false

This attribute is true if the price in the BOM should used in the order, otherwise false.
Valid Values: true or false
The user entered value associated to the LineItem.
The holder of additional line prices associated with the LineItem. It contains one or more AdditionalLinePrice elements.

Valid Values: true or false
The price value of the price type.
The name of the price type

A holder of input properties applicable for the current model. It contains:
External properties injected into the current model.
Properties derived from parent state, based on the input property list defined in the current model. This information is initially captured while punching into the current model from its parent.
These input property values are considered while evaluating the rules in the current model.
This element holds information about input properties for the current model.
The flag to indicate whether the property is an external input property or not. Default value is N .
The name of the property in the property pool.
The path to a property from the property pool.
The datatype of the property.
The value of the property.
The xml element contains information of error messages.
The message.
The path to the message.
The xml element contains information of warning messages.
The message.
The path to the message.
The xml element containes information of suggestion messages.
The message.
The path to the message.
A holder of properties from the configurator state.
The xml element containes information of suggestion messages.
The name of the property in the property pool.
The path to a property from the property pool.
The datatype of the property.
The value of the property.
The message of the rule trace.
The time of the rule trace.
This element holds information about tabs.
Flag indicating if the tab returned has errors or not.
The guiding text for the tab.
The name of the tab.
Flag indicating if the tab returned has suggestions or not.
Flag indicating if the tab returned has warnings or not.
This element holds information about the member option classes.
The name of a member option class.
This element holds information about the section.
The name of the section.
This element holds information about the section item.
The description of the section item.
The full name of the section item.
Configurator item id of the node. For any given model the item ids are unique within that model. The id of the root node of a model is always 0.
The name of the section item.
The price of the section item.
The quantity of the section item.
The sku of the section item.
This element holds information about properties associated to item.
The name of the property.
The path to the item that contains the property.

The datatype of the property.
Valid Values: bigdecimal or int or List or long or double or String or date or unknown
The value in string form for the property. List values are returned with each value separated by a carriage return.
This element holds information about the option classes.
Configurator item id of the node. For any given model the item ids are unique within that model. The id of the root node of a model is always 0.
The name for the option class.
The full path to the option class (which includes its name as the last portion of the path).
This element holds information about properties associated to item.
The name of the property.
The path to the item that contains the property.

The datatype of the property.
Valid Values: bigdecimal or int or List or long or double or String or date or unknown
The value in string form for the property. List values are returned with each value separated by a carriage return.
This element holds information about the option item.
Configurator item id of the node. For any given model, the item ids are unique within that model. The root node of a model is always ID=0.
The name for the option item.
The full path to the option item (which includes its name as the last portion of the path).
This element holds information about properties associated to item.
The name of the property.
The path to the item that contains the property.

The datatype of the property.
Valid Values: bigdecimal or int or List or long or double or String or date or unknown
The value in string form for the property. List values are returned with each value separated by a carriage return.
